greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Denominator of sum of fractions A182972(k) / A182973(k) such that A182972(k) + A182973(k) = n.
comment: A182972(n) and A182973(n) provide an enumeration of positive rationals < 1 arranged by increasing sum of numerator and denominator then by increasing numerator;
a(n) = denominator(sum(A182972(k)/A182973(k): k such that A182972(k)+A182973(k)=n));
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 3..1000
Paul Yiu, Recreational Mathematics, 24.3.1 Appendix: Two enumerations of the rational numbers in (0,1), page 633.
program: [num % den | num <- [1 .. div n 2], let den = n - num, gcd num den == 1]
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 30 2014
